page.title: 14EDUCATION KILMERSDON SCHOOLS
page.content:
The Primary School, a voluntary aided Church of England school, was threatened with closure in l965, but now has ll0 pupils drawn from Kilmersdon and surrounding villages where schools have been closed. The head teacher is no longer resident: The house is now used for school activities.
Adult Education - The stable block at Ammerdown now serves as a study centre. It was founded by a group of multi-denominational Christians. It is a setting in which people may study, meditate, discuss or worship as they please. There are social studies and courses on local history, literature, music and fine arts.
